		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="impactStartTime")]
		public System.Nullable<System.DateTimeOffset> ImpactStartTime { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// It provides information if the event is High incident rate event or not.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="isHIR")]
		public System.Nullable<System.Boolean> IsHIR { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// It provides the Timestamp for when the health impacting event was last updated.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="lastUpdateTime")]
		public System.Nullable<System.DateTimeOffset> LastUpdateTime { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Level of insight.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="level")]
		public System.Nullable<event_PropertiesLevel> Level { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Useful links of event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="links")]
		public Link[] Links { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Priority level of the event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="priority")]
		public System.Nullable<System.Int32> Priority { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Recommended actions of event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="recommendedActions")]
		public event_PropertiesRecommendedActions RecommendedActions { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Current status of event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="status")]
		public ImpactedServiceRegionStatus Status { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Summary text of event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="summary")]
		public string Summary { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Title text of event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="title")]
		public string Title { get; set; }
	}
	
	public class event_PropertiesArticle
	{
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Article content of event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="articleContent")]
		public string ArticleContent { get; set; }
	}
	
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/01")]
	public enum event_PropertiesEventLevel
	{
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		Critical = 0,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		Warning = 1,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		Informational = 2,
	}

	{

		ResourceHealth = 0,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		ServiceHealth = 1,
	}

		ServiceIssue = 0,

		PlannedMaintenance = 1,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		HealthAdvisory = 2,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		RCA = 3,
	}
	
	/// <summary>
	/// Frequently asked question for the service health event
	/// </summary>
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/01")]
	public class Faq
	{
		
		/// <summary>
		/// FAQ answer for the service health event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="answer")]
		public string Answer { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// FAQ locale for the service health event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="localeCode")]
		public string LocaleCode { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// FAQ question for the service health event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="question")]
		public string Question { get; set; }
	}
	
	/// <summary>
	/// Azure service impacted by the service health event.
	/// </summary>
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/01")]
	public class Impact
	{
		
		/// <summary>
		/// List regions impacted by the service health event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="impactedRegions")]
		public ImpactedServiceRegion[] ImpactedRegions { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Impacted service name.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="impactedService")]
		public string ImpactedService { get; set; }
	}
	
	/// <summary>
	/// Azure region impacted by the service health event.
	/// </summary>
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/01")]
	public class ImpactedServiceRegion
	{
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Impacted region name.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="impactedRegion")]
		public string ImpactedRegion { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// List subscription impacted by the service health event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="impactedSubscriptions")]
		public string[] ImpactedSubscriptions { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// It provides the Timestamp for when the last update for the service health event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="lastUpdateTime")]
		public System.Nullable<System.DateTimeOffset> LastUpdateTime { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Current status of event in the region.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="status")]
		public System.Nullable<ImpactedServiceRegionStatus> Status { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// List of updates for given service health event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="updates")]
		public Update[] Updates { get; set; }
	}
	
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/01")]
	public enum ImpactedServiceRegionStatus
	{
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		Active = 0,
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		Resolved = 1,
	}

	{

	/// <summary>
	/// Useful links for service health event.
	/// </summary>
	[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContract(Namespace="http://fonlow.com/TestOpenApi/2024/01")]
	public class Link
	{
		
		/// <summary>
		/// It provides the name of portal extension blade to produce link for given service health event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="bladeName")]
		public string BladeName { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Display text of link.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="displayText")]
		public LinkDisplayText DisplayText { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// It provides the name of portal extension to produce link for given service health event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="extensionName")]
		public string ExtensionName { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// It provides a map of parameter name and value for portal extension blade to produce lik for given service health event.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="parameters")]
		public string Parameters { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Type of link.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="type")]
		public System.Nullable<LinkType> Type { get; set; }
	}

	{

		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="localizedValue")]

		/// <summary>
		/// Display text of link.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="value")]
		public string Value { get; set; }
	}

		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute()]
		Hyperlink = 1,
	}

	/// <summary>
	/// The List events operation response.
	/// </summary>

	{

		public string NextLink { get; set; }

		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="value")]

	}
	
	/// <summary>
	/// Operation available in the resourcehealth resource provider.
	/// </summary>

	{
		
		/// <summary>

		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="display")]
		public OperationDisplay Display { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Name of the operation.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="name")]
		public string Name { get; set; }
	}
	
	public class OperationDisplay
	{
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Description of the operation.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="description")]
		public string Description { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Operation name.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="operation")]
		public string Operation { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Provider name.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="provider")]
		public string Provider { get; set; }
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Resource name.
		/// </summary>
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="resource")]
		public string Resource { get; set; }
	}
	
	/// <summary>
	/// Lists the operations response.
	/// </summary>

	{

		/// List of operations available in the resourcehealth resource provider.

		/// </summary>

		[System.Runtime.Serialization.DataMember(Name="value")]
		public Operation[] Value { get; set; }

	public partial class Misc
	{
		
		private System.Net.Http.HttpClient httpClient;
		
		private JsonSerializerOptions jsonSerializerSettings;
		
		public Misc(System.Net.Http.HttpClient httpClient, JsonSerializerOptions jsonSerializerSettings=null)
		{
			if (httpClient == null)
				throw new ArgumentNullException("Null HttpClient.", "httpClient");

			if (httpClient.BaseAddress == null)
				throw new ArgumentNullException("HttpClient has no BaseAddress", "httpClient");

			this.httpClient = httpClient;
			this.jsonSerializerSettings = jsonSerializerSettings;
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Lists Azure services' emerging issues.
		/// EmergingIssues_List providers/Microsoft.ResourceHealth/emergingIssues
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="api_version">Client Api Version.</param>
		/// <returns>The body contains a list of azure emerging issues.</returns>
		public async Task<EmergingIssueListResult> EmergingIssues_ListAsync(string api_version)
		{
			var requestUri = "providers/Microsoft.ResourceHealth/emergingIssues?api-version=" + (api_version==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(api_version));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var contentString = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStringAsync();
				return JsonSerializer.Deserialize<EmergingIssueListResult>(contentString, jsonSerializerSettings);
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Gets Azure services' emerging issues.
		/// EmergingIssues_Get providers/Microsoft.ResourceHealth/emergingIssues/{issueName}
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="issueName">The name of the emerging issue.</param>
		/// <param name="api_version">Client Api Version.</param>
		/// <returns>The body contains properties of azure emerging issues, which includes a list of status banner and status active events.</returns>
		public async Task<EmergingIssuesGetResult> EmergingIssues_GetAsync(EmergingIssues_GetIssueName issueName, string api_version)
		{
			var requestUri = "providers/Microsoft.ResourceHealth/emergingIssues/"+issueName+"?api-version=" + (api_version==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(api_version));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var contentString = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStringAsync();
				return JsonSerializer.Deserialize<EmergingIssuesGetResult>(contentString, jsonSerializerSettings);
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Lists available operations for the resourcehealth resource provider
		/// Operations_List providers/Microsoft.ResourceHealth/operations
		/// </summary>

				return JsonSerializer.Deserialize<OperationListResult>(contentString, jsonSerializerSettings);

			finally

			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Lists the current availability status for all the resources in the subscription.
		/// AvailabilityStatuses_ListBySubscriptionId subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/providers/Microsoft.ResourceHealth/availabilityStatuses
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="api_version">Client Api Version.</param>
		/// <param name="filter">The filter to apply on the operation. For more information please see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/apimanagement/apis?redirectedfrom=MSDN</param>
		/// <param name="subscriptionId">Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.</param>
		/// <param name="expand">Setting $expand=recommendedactions in url query expands the recommendedactions in the response.</param>
		/// <returns>The list of current availability status for all the resources in the subscription</returns>
		public async Task<AvailabilityStatusListResult> AvailabilityStatuses_ListBySubscriptionIdAsync(string api_version, string filter, string subscriptionId, string expand)
		{
			var requestUri = "subscriptions/"+ (subscriptionId==null? 			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var contentString = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStringAsync();
				return JsonSerializer.Deserialize<AvailabilityStatusListResult>(contentString, jsonSerializerSettings);
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Lists current service health events in the subscription.

		/// </summary>

		/// <param name="view">setting view=full expands the article parameters</param>

		/// <param name="resourceGroupName">The name of the resource group.</param>
		/// <param name="api_version">Client Api Version.</param>

			{
			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try

				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();

			finally

		/// <summary>
		/// Lists all historical availability transitions and impacting events for a single resource.
		/// AvailabilityStatuses_List {resourceUri}/providers/Microsoft.ResourceHealth/availabilityStatuses
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="resourceUri">The fully qualified ID of the resource, including the resource name and resource type. Currently the API support not nested and one nesting level resource types : /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}/providers/{resource-provider-name}/{resource-type}/{resource-name} and /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resource-provider-name}/{parentResourceType}/{parentResourceName}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}</param>
		/// <param name="api_version">Client Api Version.</param>
		/// <param name="filter">The filter to apply on the operation. For more information please see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/apimanagement/apis?redirectedfrom=MSDN</param>
		/// <param name="expand">Setting $expand=recommendedactions in url query expands the recommendedactions in the response.</param>
		/// <returns>The list of historical availability statuses for a single resource</returns>
		public async Task<AvailabilityStatusListResult> AvailabilityStatuses_ListAsync(string resourceUri, string api_version, string filter, string expand)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+ (resourceUri==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(resourceUri))+"/providers/Microsoft.ResourceHealth/availabilityStatuses&api-version=" + (api_version==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(api_version))+"&$filter=" + (filter==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(filter))+"&$expand=" + (expand==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(expand));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var contentString = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStringAsync();
				return JsonSerializer.Deserialize<AvailabilityStatusListResult>(contentString, jsonSerializerSettings);
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Gets current availability status for a single resource
		/// AvailabilityStatuses_GetByResource {resourceUri}/providers/Microsoft.ResourceHealth/availabilityStatuses/current
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="resourceUri">The fully qualified ID of the resource, including the resource name and resource type. Currently the API support not nested and one nesting level resource types : /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}/providers/{resource-provider-name}/{resource-type}/{resource-name} and /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resource-provider-name}/{parentResourceType}/{parentResourceName}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}</param>
		/// <param name="api_version">Client Api Version.</param>
		/// <param name="filter">The filter to apply on the operation. For more information please see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/apimanagement/apis?redirectedfrom=MSDN</param>
		/// <param name="expand">Setting $expand=recommendedactions in url query expands the recommendedactions in the response.</param>
		/// <returns>The current availability status for a single resource</returns>
		public async Task<AvailabilityStatus> AvailabilityStatuses_GetByResourceAsync(string resourceUri, string api_version, string filter, string expand)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+ (resourceUri==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(resourceUri))+"/providers/Microsoft.ResourceHealth/availabilityStatuses/current&api-version=" + (api_version==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(api_version))+"&$filter=" + (filter==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(filter))+"&$expand=" + (expand==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(expand));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var contentString = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStringAsync();
				return JsonSerializer.Deserialize<AvailabilityStatus>(contentString, jsonSerializerSettings);
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
		
		/// <summary>
		/// Lists current service health events for given resource.
		/// Events_ListBySingleResource {resourceUri}/providers/Microsoft.ResourceHealth/events
		/// </summary>
		/// <param name="resourceUri">The fully qualified ID of the resource, including the resource name and resource type. Currently the API support not nested and one nesting level resource types : /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}/providers/{resource-provider-name}/{resource-type}/{resource-name} and /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resource-provider-name}/{parentResourceType}/{parentResourceName}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}</param>
		/// <param name="api_version">Client Api Version.</param>
		/// <param name="filter">The filter to apply on the operation. For more information please see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/apimanagement/apis?redirectedfrom=MSDN</param>
		/// <param name="view">setting view=full expands the article parameters</param>
		/// <returns>The list of current service health events for given resource</returns>
		public async Task<Events> Events_ListBySingleResourceAsync(string resourceUri, string api_version, string filter, string view)
		{
			var requestUri = ""+ (resourceUri==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(resourceUri))+"/providers/Microsoft.ResourceHealth/events&api-version=" + (api_version==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(api_version))+"&$filter=" + (filter==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(filter))+"&view=" + (view==null? "" : System.Uri.EscapeDataString(view));
			using (var httpRequestMessage = new System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod.Get, requestUri))
			{
			var responseMessage = await httpClient.SendAsync(httpRequestMessage);
			try
			{
				responseMessage.EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx();
				var contentString = await responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStringAsync();
				return JsonSerializer.Deserialize<Events>(contentString, jsonSerializerSettings);
			}
			finally
			{
				responseMessage.Dispose();
			}
			}
		}
	}
	
	public enum EmergingIssues_GetIssueName
	{
		
		[System.Runtime.Serialization.EnumMemberAttribute(Value="default")]
		_default = 0,
	}
}

namespace Fonlow.Net.Http
{
	using System.Net.Http;

	public class WebApiRequestException : HttpRequestException
	{
		public System.Net.HttpStatusCode StatusCode { get; private set; }

		public string Response { get; private set; }

		public System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpResponseHeaders Headers { get; private set; }

		public System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue ContentType { get; private set; }

		public WebApiRequestException(string message, System.Net.HttpStatusCode statusCode, string response, System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpResponseHeaders headers, System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue contentType) : base(message)
		{
			StatusCode = statusCode;
			Response = response;
			Headers = headers;
			ContentType = contentType;
		}
	}

	public static class ResponseMessageExtensions
	{
		public static void EnsureSuccessStatusCodeEx(this HttpResponseMessage responseMessage)
		{
			if (!responseMessage.IsSuccessStatusCode)
			{
				var responseText = responseMessage.Content.ReadAsStringAsync().Result;
				var contentType = responseMessage.Content.Headers.ContentType;
				throw new WebApiRequestException(responseMessage.ReasonPhrase, responseMessage.StatusCode, responseText, responseMessage.Headers, contentType);
			}
		}
	}
}
